accordion.name: Accordion
accordion.description: A vertically stacked set of interactive headings that each reveal a section of content.

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: Single item expansion by default
examples.source: What is React? React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create reusable UI components. What is Solid? SolidJS is a declarative, efficient, and flexible JavaScript library for building user interfaces with fine-grained reactivity. What is Vue? Vue is a progressive framework for building user interfaces, designed to be incrementally adoptable.

examples.title: Collapsible
examples.description: Allow all panels to be closed
examples.source: Can I close all items? Yes! With the collapsible prop, you can close all accordion items by clicking the open item. Is it animated? Absolutely. The accordion uses smooth CSS animations for opening and closing.

examples.title: Multiple
examples.description: Allow multiple panels to be open simultaneously
examples.source: Features Full keyboard navigation, collapsible items, and smooth animations built-in. Accessibility Complies with WAI-ARIA design patterns and supports screen readers. Styling Fully customizable with Tailwind CSS and class variance authority.

examples.title: Outlined
examples.description: Accordion with outlined styling
examples.source:
Installation New
Install the package using your favorite package manager: npm install @ark-ui/solid Usage Import the components and start building your accordion UI with full TypeScript support.
Customization Updated
Use CVA variants and Tailwind classes to customize the look and feel.

examples.title: Disabled
examples.description: Accordion with disabled items
examples.source: Available This accordion item is available and can be toggled. Disabled This item is disabled and cannot be opened. Enabled This accordion item is also available.

angle-slider.name: AngleSlider
angle-slider.description: An angle slider component for selecting angular values (0-360 degrees). Built on Ark UI AngleSlider - all Ark UI AngleSlider props are supported.

props.name: centerValue
props.type:
| boolean
    | JSX.Element
    | ((context: { value: number; valueAsDegree: string }) => JSX.Element)

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: A simple angle slider with the value displayed in the center
examples.source:
<AngleSlider
  id="angle-slider-basic"
  label="Wind Direction"
  defaultValue={21}
  centerValue
/>

examples.title: Custom Step with Markers
examples.description: An angle slider with 45-degree step increments and aligned markers, with wrapping disabled
examples.source:
<AngleSlider
  id="angle-slider-step"
  label="Rotation"
  defaultValue={90}
  step={45}
  markers={[0, 45, 90, 135, 180, 225, 270, 315]}
  centerValue
/>

examples.title: Disabled
examples.description: A disabled angle slider with reduced opacity
examples.source:
<AngleSlider
  id="angle-slider-disabled"
  label="Disabled"
  defaultValue={135}
  showMarkers
  disabled
  centerValue
/>

examples.title: Custom Size
examples.description: An angle slider with custom size dimensions

examples.title: Organization Tree Chart
examples.description: Hierarchical tree visualization of an organization structure
examples.source:
<Chart
  size="lg"
  option={{
    tooltip: {
      trigger: "item",
      triggerOn: "mousemove",
    },
    series: [
      {
        type: "tree",
        data: [
          {
            name: "CEO",
            children: [
              {
                name: "CTO",
                children: [
                  {
                    name: "Engineering",
                    children: [
                      { name: "Frontend Team" },
                      { name: "Backend Team" },
                      { name: "DevOps Team" },
                    ],
                  },
                  {
                    name: "Product",
                    children: [
                      { name: "Design Team" },
                      { name: "Research Team" },
                    ],
                  },
                ],
              },
              {
                name: "CFO",
                children: [
                  {
                    name: "Finance",
                    children: [
                      { name: "Accounting" },
                      { name: "Treasury" },
                    ],
                  },
                  {
                    name: "Legal",
                    children: [{ name: "Compliance" }],
                  },
                ],
              },
              {
                name: "CMO",
                children: [
                  {
                    name: "Marketing",
                    children: [
                      { name: "Content Team" },
                      { name: "Social Media" },
                      { name: "SEO Team" },
                    ],
                  },
                  {
                    name: "Sales",
                    children: [
                      { name: "Enterprise Sales" },
                      { name: "SMB Sales" },
                    ],
                  },
                ],
              },
            ],
          },
        ],
        top: "5%",
        left: "7%",
        bottom: "2%",
        right: "20%",
        symbolSize: 7,
        label: {
          position: "left",
          verticalAlign: "middle",
          align: "right",
          fontSize: 12,
        },
        leaves: {
          label: {
            position: "right",
            verticalAlign: "middle",
            align: "left",
          },
        },
        emphasis: {
          focus: "descendant",
        },
        expandAndCollapse: true,
        animationDuration: 550,
        animationDurationUpdate: 750,
      },
    ],
  }}
  id="tree-chart"
/>

dialog.name: Dialog
dialog.description: A modal dialog component with composable parts. Uses Ark UI for accessibility and focus management.

examples.title: Basic Dialog
examples.description: A simple dialog with trigger, title and description
examples.source:
<Dialog>
  <DialogTrigger>
    <Button>Open Dialog</Button>
  </DialogTrigger>
  <DialogContent>
    <DialogTitle>
      Dialog Title
      <Badge variant="secondary" class="ml-2">
        New
      </Badge>
    </DialogTitle>
    <DialogDescription>
      This is a basic dialog with a title and description.
    </DialogDescription>
    <DialogFooter>
      <DialogClose>
        <Button variant="outline">Close</Button>
      </DialogClose>
    </DialogFooter>
  </DialogContent>
</Dialog>

examples.title: Controlled Dialog
examples.description: Control dialog state externally
examples.source:
const dialog = createDialogState();
return (
  <>
    <Button onClick={dialog.open}>Open Dialog</Button>
    <Dialog
      open={dialog.isOpen()}
      onOpenChange={(e) => dialog.setOpen(e.open)}
    >
      <DialogContent>
        <DialogTitle>Controlled Dialog</DialogTitle>
        <DialogDescription>
          This dialog is controlled by external state using the
          createDialogState helper.
        </DialogDescription>
        <DialogFooter>
          <Button variant="outline" onClick={dialog.close}>
            Close
          </Button>
        </DialogFooter>
      </DialogContent>
    </Dialog>
  </>
);

examples.title: Dialog with Form
examples.description: Dialog containing form elements
examples.source: Edit Profile Make changes to your profile here. Click save when you're done.

drawer.name: Drawer
drawer.description: A drawer component that slides in from any edge of the screen. Supports drag-to-dismiss, keyboard navigation, and focus management. Custom implementation with full directional support.

examples.title: Bottom Drawer
examples.description: Default drawer that slides up from the bottom
examples.source:
Drawer Title This is a drawer that slides in from the bottom. Drag it down to dismiss.

Drawer content goes here. You can add any content you want.

examples.title: Right Drawer
examples.description: Drawer that slides in from the right side
examples.source:
<Drawer side="right">
  <DrawerTrigger>
    <Button variant="outline">Open Right Drawer</Button>
  </DrawerTrigger>
  <DrawerPortal>
    <DrawerContent withHandle={false}>
      <DrawerCloseTrigger />
      <DrawerHeader>
        <DrawerTitle>Navigation Menu</DrawerTitle>
        <DrawerDescription>
          Browse through available options
        </DrawerDescription>
      </DrawerHeader>
      <DrawerBody>
        <nav class="space-y-2">
          <button class="w-full text-left px-3 py-2 rounded-md hover:bg-accent">
            Dashboard
          </button>
          <button class="w-full text-left px-3 py-2 rounded-md hover:bg-accent">
            Settings
          </button>
          <button class="w-full text-left px-3 py-2 rounded-md hover:bg-accent">
            Profile
          </button>
          <button class="w-full text-left px-3 py-2 rounded-md hover:bg-accent">
            Logout
          </button>
        </nav>
      </DrawerBody>
    </DrawerContent>
  </DrawerPortal>
</Drawer>

examples.title: Annotation Types
examples.description: Different annotation styles
examples.source:
Highlight {" "} makes text stand out with a background color.

Underline {" "} draws a line beneath the text.

Box {" "} surrounds the text with a rectangle.

Circle {" "} draws a circle around short text.

Strike-through {" "} crosses out the text.

image.name: Image
image.description:
A responsive image component powered by @responsive-image/solid. Automatically generates optimized images in multiple sizes and formats (WebP, AVIF) with Low Quality Image Placeholders (LQIP). Supports both local images (processed at build time) and regular image URLs. 

**Setup Required**: Add the Vite plugin to your `app.config.ts`:

```typescript
import { setupPlugins } from

examples.title: Responsive Image
examples.description: Automatically fills container width with optimized sizes
examples.source:
<Image
  src="https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1506905925346-21bda4d32df4?w=1200"
  alt="Mountain landscape"
/>

examples.title: Fixed Size Image
examples.description: Render an image with fixed dimensions and 2x for retina
examples.source:
<Image
  src="https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1506905925346-21bda4d32df4?w=400"
  alt="Mountain landscape"
  width={400}
  layout="fixed"
/>

examples.title: Priority Image (LCP)
examples.description: Disable lazy loading for above-the-fold hero images
examples.source:
<Image
  src="https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1506905925346-21bda4d32df4?w=1200"
  alt="Hero image"
  priority
  objectFit="cover"
/>

examples.description: Control how the image fits within its container

json-tree-view.name: JsonTreeView
json-tree-view.description: A component for displaying and exploring JSON data in a tree structure. Perfect for debugging, API responses, and configuration viewers.

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: Display JSON data in a tree view with various data types
examples.source:
<JsonTreeView
  label="User Data"
  data={{
    name: "John Doe",
    age: 30,
    email: "john.doe@example.com",
    balance: 1234.56,
    score: -42,
    isActive: true,
    isVerified: false,
    avatar: null,
    description: undefined,
    createdAt: new Date("2024-01-15T14:22:00.000Z"),
    lastLogin: new Date("2024-01-12T00:00:00.000Z"),
    tags: ["user", "premium", "verified"],
    scores: [95, 87, 92, 78, 100],
    address: {
      street: "123 Main St",
      city: "Anytown",
      state: "CA",
      zip: 12345,
      coordinates: {
        lat: 37.7749,
        lng: -122.4194,
      },
    },
    greet: (name: string) => `Hello, ${name}!`,
    emailPattern: /^[^\s@]+@[^\s@]+\.[^\s@]+$/,
    lastError: new Error("Something went wrong"),
    preferences: new Map([
      ["theme", "dark"],
      ["language", "en"],
      ["notifications", "enabled"],
    ]),
    visitedPages: new Set(["/home", "/profile", "/settings"]),
    mixedData: [
      "string",
      42,
      true,
      null,
      { nested: "object" },
      [1, 2, 3],
      new Date(),
    ],
  }}
/>

examples.title: Expand Depth
examples.description: Control how many levels are expanded by default
examples.source:
<JsonTreeView
  label="Configuration"
  defaultExpandedDepth={1}
  data={{
    server: {
      host: "localhost",
      port: 3000,
      ssl: {
        enabled: true,
        cert: "/path/to/cert",
        key: "/path/to/key",
      },
    },
    database: {
      host: "db.example.com",
      port: 5432,
      credentials: {
        username: "admin",
        password: "********",
      },
    },
  }}
/>

examples.title: Array Data
examples.description: Display arrays and nested structures
examples.source:
<JsonTreeView
  label="API Response"
  data={{
    users: [
      { id: 1, name: "Alice", active: true },
      { id: 2, name: "Bob", active: false },
      { id: 3, name: "Charlie", active: true },
    ],
    meta: {
      total: 3,
      page: 1,
      perPage: 10,
    },
  }}
/>

examples.title: Mixed Types
examples.description: Display various JavaScript data types
examples.source:
<JsonTreeView
  label="Data Types"
  defaultExpandedDepth={2}
  data={{
    string: "Hello World",
    number: 42,
    boolean: true,
    null: null,
    undefined: undefined,
    array: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5],
    object: {
      nested: "value",
      deep: {
        deeper: "data",
      },
    },
  }}
/>

  <MenuTrigger variant="outline">
    <div class="h-4 w-4 mr-2 i-lucide-settings" />
    Actions
  </MenuTrigger>
  <MenuContent>
    <MenuItem value="new">
      <div class="h-4 w-4 mr-2 i-lucide-file-plus" />

    </MenuItem>
    <MenuItem value="open">
      <div class="h-4 w-4 mr-2 i-lucide-folder-open" />
      Open File
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuItem value="save">
      <div class="h-4 w-4 mr-2 i-lucide-save" />
      Save
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuSeparator />
    <MenuItem value="settings">
      <div class="h-4 w-4 mr-2 i-lucide-settings" />
      Settings
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuItem value="exit">
      <div class="h-4 w-4 mr-2 i-lucide-log-out" />

</Menu>

pin-input.name: PinInput
pin-input.description: A pin input component for entering sequences of digits or characters. Built on Ark UI PinInput - all Ark UI PinInput props are supported.

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: A basic 6-digit pin input
examples.source:
<PinInput
  label="Enter PIN"
  placeholder="○"
  onValueComplete={(e) => console.log("Complete:", e.valueAsString)}
/>

examples.title: 4-Digit PIN
examples.description: A shorter 4-digit pin input
examples.source:
<PinInput
  label="Security PIN"
  count={4}
  placeholder="○"
  onValueComplete={(e) => console.log("PIN:", e.valueAsString)}
/>

examples.description: One-time password input with auto-complete
examples.source:
<PinInput
  label="Verification Code"
  count={6}
  otp
  type="numeric"
  placeholder="0"
  onValueComplete={(e) => console.log("OTP:", e.valueAsString)}
/>

examples.title: Masked Input
examples.description: Pin input with masked values for security
examples.source:
<PinInput
  label="Secure PIN"
  count={4}
  mask
  type="numeric"
  placeholder="○"
  onValueComplete={(e) => console.log("Secure PIN entered")}
/>

examples.title: Alphanumeric
examples.description: Pin input that accepts letters and numbers
examples.source:
<PinInput
  label="Activation Code"
  count={5}
  type="alphanumeric"
  placeholder="-"
  onValueComplete={(e) => console.log("Code:", e.valueAsString)}
/>

examples.description: Build custom layouts with composable parts
examples.source:
<SignaturePadRoot class="w-full max-w-2xl">
  <SignaturePadLabel>Please sign here</SignaturePadLabel>
  <SignaturePadControl class="h-64">
    <SignaturePadSegment />
    <SignaturePadClearTrigger class="absolute top-2 right-2">

    </SignaturePadClearTrigger>
    <SignaturePadGuide class="absolute bottom-16 left-0 right-0" />
  </SignaturePadControl>
</SignaturePadRoot>

snippet.name: Snippet
snippet.description: A code snippet component with syntax highlighting, copy functionality, and tab support for multiple code examples. Perfect for documentation and showcasing code.

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: Simple code snippet with copy button

examples.title: Multiple Tabs
examples.description: Code snippet with multiple language examples
examples.source:
<Snippet defaultValue="npm" class="max-w-2xl">
  <SnippetHeader>
    <SnippetTabsList>
      <SnippetIndicator />
      <SnippetTabsTrigger value="npm">npm</SnippetTabsTrigger>
      <SnippetTabsTrigger value="yarn">yarn</SnippetTabsTrigger>
      <SnippetTabsTrigger value="pnpm">pnpm</SnippetTabsTrigger>
      <SnippetTabsTrigger value="bun">bun</SnippetTabsTrigger>
    </SnippetTabsList>
    <SnippetCopyButton value="npm install @method-ui/core" />
  </SnippetHeader>
  <SnippetTabsContent value="npm">
    npm install @method-ui/core
  </SnippetTabsContent>
  <SnippetTabsContent value="yarn">
    yarn add @method-ui/core
  </SnippetTabsContent>
  <SnippetTabsContent value="pnpm">
    pnpm add @method-ui/core
  </SnippetTabsContent>
  <SnippetTabsContent value="bun">
    bun add @method-ui/core
  </SnippetTabsContent>
</Snippet>

tree-view.name: TreeView
tree-view.description: A tree view component that displays hierarchical data in an expandable structure. Perfect for file explorers, navigation menus, and nested lists.

examples.title: Basic
examples.description: A simple tree view with folders and files
examples.source:
<TreeView
  label="Project Files"
  data={[
    {
      id: "node_modules",
      name: "node_modules",
      children: [
        { id: "node_modules/zag-js", name: "zag-js" },
        {
          id: "node_modules/@types",
          name: "@types",
          children: [
            { id: "node_modules/@types/react", name: "react" },
            {
              id: "node_modules/@types/react-dom",
              name: "react-dom",
            },
          ],
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: "src",
      name: "src",
      children: [
        { id: "src/app.tsx", name: "app.tsx" },
        { id: "src/index.ts", name: "index.ts" },
      ],
    },
    { id: "package.json", name: "package.json" },
    { id: "readme.md", name: "README.md" },
  ]}
/>

examples.title: With Selection
examples.description: Tree view with single selection enabled
examples.source:
<TreeView
  label="Documentation"
  selectionMode="single"
  defaultSelectedValue={["docs/getting-started"]}
  data={[
    {
      id: "docs",
      name: "Documentation",
      children: [
        { id: "docs/getting-started", name: "Getting Started" },
        { id: "docs/installation", name: "Installation" },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: "examples",
      name: "Examples",
      children: [
        { id: "examples/react", name: "React Examples" },
        { id: "examples/vue", name: "Vue Examples" },
      ],
    },
  ]}
/>
